info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 2:57AM PST until December 16 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches for lower elevation areas between 1500 and 2500 feet and 5 to 12 inches above 2500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph in exposed areas. * WHERE...Higher terrain of Eastern Curry County and Josephine County including Hayes Hill on Highway 199 and Sexton Pass on Interstate 5. This also includes the hills around the Illinois, Applegate and lower Rogue Valleys as well as areas near O`Brien. * WHEN...From 8 AM Wednesday to 8 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will likely fluctuate between 1500 feet and 2000 feet through the Advisory period. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
